00001 /**********************************************************************
00002 * $Id$          pwm_single_edge.c                               2010-05-21
00003 */
00026 #include "lpc17xx_pwm.h"
00027 #include "lpc17xx_libcfg.h"
00028 #include "lpc17xx_pinsel.h"
00029 
00030 /* Example group ----------------------------------------------------------- */
00036 /*-------------------------MAIN FUNCTION------------------------------*/
00037 /*********************************************************************/
00042 int c_entry(void)
00043 {
00044         uint8_t temp, temp2;
00045         PWM_TIMERCFG_Type PWMCfgDat;
00046         PWM_MATCHCFG_Type PWMMatchCfgDat;
00047         PINSEL_CFG_Type PinCfg;
00048 
00049         /* PWM block section -------------------------------------------- */
00050         /* Initialize PWM peripheral, timer mode
00051          * PWM prescale value = 1 (absolute value - tick value) */
00052         PWMCfgDat.PrescaleOption = PWM_TIMER_PRESCALE_TICKVAL;
00053         PWMCfgDat.PrescaleValue = 1;
00054         PWM_Init(LPC_PWM1, PWM_MODE_TIMER, (void *) &PWMCfgDat);
00055 
00056         /*
00057          * Initialize PWM pin connect
00058          */
00059         PinCfg.Funcnum = 1;
00060         PinCfg.OpenDrain = 0;
00061         PinCfg.Pinmode = 0;
00062         PinCfg.Portnum = 2;
00063         for (temp = 0; temp <= 6; temp++){
00064                 PinCfg.Pinnum = temp;
00065                 PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00066         }
00067 
00068 
00069         /* Set match value for PWM match channel 0 = 256, update immediately */
00070         PWM_MatchUpdate(LPC_PWM1, 0, 256, PWM_MATCH_UPDATE_NOW);
00071         /* PWM Timer/Counter will be reset when channel 0 matching
00072          * no interrupt when match
00073          * no stop when match */
00074         PWMMatchCfgDat.IntOnMatch = DISABLE;
00075         PWMMatchCfgDat.MatchChannel = 0;
00076         PWMMatchCfgDat.ResetOnMatch = ENABLE;
00077         PWMMatchCfgDat.StopOnMatch = DISABLE;
00078         PWM_ConfigMatch(LPC_PWM1, &PWMMatchCfgDat);
00079 
00080         /* Configure each PWM channel: --------------------------------------------- */
00081         /* - Single edge
00082          * - PWM Duty on each PWM channel determined by
00083          * the match on channel 0 to the match of that match channel.
00084          * Example: PWM Duty on PWM channel 1 determined by
00085          * the match on channel 0 to the match of match channel 1.
00086          */
00087 
00088         /* Configure PWM channel edge option
00089          * Note: PWM Channel 1 is in single mode as default state and
00090          * can not be changed to double edge mode */
00091         for (temp = 2; temp < 7; temp++)
00092         {
00093                 PWM_ChannelConfig(LPC_PWM1, temp, PWM_CHANNEL_SINGLE_EDGE);
00094         }
00095 
00096 
00097         /* Configure match value for each match channel */
00098         temp2 = 10;
00099         for (temp = 1; temp < 7; temp++)
00100         {
00101                 /* Set up match value */
00102                 PWM_MatchUpdate(LPC_PWM1, temp, temp2, PWM_MATCH_UPDATE_NOW);
00103                 /* Configure match option */
00104                 PWMMatchCfgDat.IntOnMatch = DISABLE;
00105                 PWMMatchCfgDat.MatchChannel = temp;
00106                 PWMMatchCfgDat.ResetOnMatch = DISABLE;
00107                 PWMMatchCfgDat.StopOnMatch = DISABLE;
00108                 PWM_ConfigMatch(LPC_PWM1, &PWMMatchCfgDat);
00109                 /* Enable PWM Channel Output */
00110                 PWM_ChannelCmd(LPC_PWM1, temp, ENABLE);
00111                 /* Increase match value by 10 */
00112                 temp2 += 10;
00113         }
00114 
00115         /* Reset and Start counter */
00116         PWM_ResetCounter(LPC_PWM1);
00117         PWM_CounterCmd(LPC_PWM1, ENABLE);
00118 
00119         /* Start PWM now */
00120         PWM_Cmd(LPC_PWM1, ENABLE);
00121 
00122     /* Loop forever */
00123     while(1);
00124     return 1;
00125 }
00126 
00127 /* With ARM and GHS toolsets, the entry point is main() - this will
00128    allow the linker to generate wrapper code to setup stacks, allocate
00129    heap area, and initialize and copy code and data segments. For GNU
00130    toolsets, the entry point is through __start() in the crt0_gnu.asm
00131    file, and that startup code will setup stacks and data */
00132 int main(void)
00133 {
00134     return c_entry();
00135 }

00138 #ifdef  DEBUG

00140 * @brief                Reports the name of the source file and the source line number
00141 *                               where the CHECK_PARAM error has occurred.
00142 * @param[in]    file Pointer to the source file name
00143 * @param[in]    line assert_param error line source number
00144 * @return               None
00145 *******************************************************************************/
00146 void check_failed(uint8_t *file, uint32_t line)
00147 {
00148         /* User can add his own implementation to report the file name and line number,
00149          ex: printf("Wrong parameters value: file %s on line %d\r\n", file, line) */
00150 
00151         /* Infinite loop */
00152         while(1);
00153 }
00154 #endif

00157  * @}
